Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from four fragments, with 1924,1201.1213) of Corinthian Black Polychrome pottery closed vessel, probably a trefoil-mouthed broad-bottomed oinochoe; exterior glazed; on shoulder, double incised tongues coloured irregularly black, red and white; below, red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.1213 and is possibly from the same vase as 1924,1201.1210 and 1211, although the sequence of colour of the tongues varies on those sherds. For parallels, see Amyx, D. A. and Lawrence, P., Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens VII.2: Archaic Corinthian Pottery and the Anaploga Well. Princeton 1975, pl. 54, fig. An 101.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 117, no. A198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.067) (Phase 1)
